verbs.description: twank (third-person singular simple present twanks, present participle twanking, simple past and past participle twanked)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, dated) To emit a sharp twanging sound.
(transitive, dated) To cause to make a sharp twanging sound.
examples: London has the privilege of disturbing a whole street for an hour together, with the twanking of a brass kettle or frying-pan.
